Package com.txtsoft.txttrafficanalyzer

Class LogsFileAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
com.txtsoft.txttrafficanalyzer.LogsFileAnalyzer
public class LogsFileAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
Class provides functionality to extract information out of FTP server log files located as zipped files in FTP host's 'logs' directory. This class expects the unzipped and loaded text content of a log file as basis to be handed over to constructor.
Author:
mb

  • Field Details

    • tmResult

      public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> tmResult
      Result of the analysis. Keys are the GET instructions with paths and names of files downloaded and values are related download counts.

    • formatterFound

      public java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter formatterFound
      right formatter to parse date with time stamps in file "traffic.txt" global content sToAnalyze.

    • iFormatterIndex

      public int iFormatterIndex
      Internal index of formatter found to be suitable out of supported formatters to read dates with time stamps in file "traffic.txt". Value -1 stands for no suitable formatter found.

    • iTotalDownloads

      public int iTotalDownloads
      Member counts no. of total downloads according to content of file "traffic.txt".

    • sToAnalyze

      public java.lang.String sToAnalyze
      Content of file "traffic.txt", which is obtained from one file of FTP host's "logs" directory in unzipped format and renamed.

    • odtMin

      public java.time.OffsetDateTime odtMin
      first date and time in analyzed log file

    • odtMax

      public java.time.OffsetDateTime odtMax
      last date and time in analyzed log file

    • odtFirst

      public java.time.OffsetDateTime odtFirst
      first date and time of ZIP or EXE download in analyzed log file

    • odtLast

      public java.time.OffsetDateTime odtLast
      last date and time of ZIP or EXE download in analyzed log file

      constructor related to a certain log file with content as handed over

  • Method Details

    • tmFillDownloadsCollection

      public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> tmFillDownloadsCollection​(java.lang.String sEndings)
      This method used global variable sToAnalyze to extract information, what files have been downloaded and how many times. Result of the analysis is given back as a collection. Fills global variable iTotalDownloads.
      Parameters:
      sEndings - endings searched for to be included in the statistics divided by the or sign, for example "zip|exe", upper and lower case does not matter
      Returns:
      Collection with keys that are the GET instructions with paths and names of files downloaded and values are related download counts. Same object as tmResult.

    • fmFind

      public java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter fmFind()
      Function gives back a suitable formatter found for date with time stamps in file "traffic.txt" global content sToAnalyze. Method sets also global iFormatterIndex.
      Returns:
      Suitable formatter found for date with time stamps in file "traffic.txt", null when not found. Same object as formatterFound.

    • fillGlobalDateTimes

      public void fillGlobalDateTimes​(java.lang.String sEndings)
      Method fills global time variables according to global content sToAnalyze: - odtMin - odtMax - odtFirst - odtLast
      Parameters:
      sEndings - endings searched for to be included in the statistics divided by the or sign, for example "zip|exe", upper and lower case does not matter

    • loadEndingsSearchedFor

      public java.lang.String loadEndingsSearchedFor()
      Function gives back string of endings in the form for example "zip|exe" read out of "config-endings.txt" file in application main directory. Every ending to be determined is stated in new line as content of this file, in the example this is: "zip exe" Upper and lower case does not matter for file's content. If file "config-endings.txt" does not exist or is empty, the default "zip|exe" is given back. Function here gives out message to console, whether "config-endings.txt" is found and not empty or whether default is assumed.
      Returns:
      string of all endings indicated in file "config-endings.txt" in the form for example "htm|html". The return value is converted to lower case.
